publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2820 Dr Sylvia Jackson: Funding for Loch Lomond and the Trossachs National Park-That the Parliament welcomes the Scottish Executive's announcement of Â£4.8 million funding for the Loch Lomond and the Trossachs National Park; recognises the social, economic and environmental benefits that the park will bring to the Loch Lomond and the Trossachs area, much of which lies in Stirling constituency, and congratulates Scottish Ministers for listening to the concerns of local people and working with all involved to provide a funding package that will allow Scotland's first national park to flourish. Supported by: Jackie Baillie*, Brian Fitzpatrick*, Des McNulty*, Cathy Peattie*, Margaret Jamieson*, Angus MacKay*, Janis Hughes*, Karen Whitefield*, Cathie Craigie*, Pauline McNeill*, Mr Duncan McNeil*, Mr Tom McCabe*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Irene Oldfather*, Trish Godman*, Johann Lamont*, Bristow Muldoon*, Scott Barrie*, Rhoda Grant*, Paul Martin*
S1M-2820 Funding for Loch Lomond and the Trossachs National Park (lodged on 1 March 2002) Donald Gorrie*
S1M-2820 Funding for Loch Lomond and the Trossachs National Park (lodged on 1 March 2002) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-2820 Funding for Loch Lomond and the Trossachs National Park (lodged on 1 March 2002) Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-2820 Funding for Loch Lomond and the Trossachs National Park (lodged on 1 March 2002) Marilyn Livingstone*, Elaine Smith*
